summary: The Youth Voting Rights Act aims to expand youth access to voting in federal elections. Key provisions include: treating public institutions of higher education as voter registration agencies; pre-registration for minors; requiring on-campus polling locations; prohibiting residency requirements for voting; ensuring student ID cards' acceptance for voter identification; providing grants to states for youth involvement in elections; amending the Voting Rights Act to enforce the 26th Amendment and address age-based voting restrictions; and mandating studies and data collection on youth voting trends. The bill seeks to address systemic barriers and encourage greater youth participation in the democratic process.
